alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Madison; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 3:41AM EDT until July 06 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD, FRANKLIN OH, NORTHEASTERN MADISON AND SOUTHERN UNION OH COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO... At 341 AM EDT, radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain continuing through portions of Central Ohio. 2 to over 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Pickerington, Worthington, Bexley, London, Jefferson, Powell, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Plain City, West Jefferson, Baltimore and Minerva Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
